name: Berry Crisp
description: This is my favorite new dessert to make every time I go visit my parents. You can add which ever berries you like the best, but I like the mixture of raspberries, blackberries, and blueberries.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit
In a large bowl add all of the berries, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, and cinnamon. Mix to combine and let sit.
In another bowl combine 1/2 cups flour, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, light brown sugar and oatmeal. Mix to combine.
Add the butter and with clean hands, mix until the butter is resembles a light crumb mixture.
Pour the berries into a 2-quart baking dish. Top with the butter flour mixture.
Bake for 1 hour. Let cool for 15 minutes. Enjoy warm topped with Häagen-Dazs vanilla bean ice cream
author: Megan Smith

name: Pecan Dreams
description: Delicious buttery cookies that are perfect for any day or any occasion! They stay fresh for a very long time and are always a big hit!
instructions: In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter on medium speed with a paddle attachment, until it is very creamy.
With the mixer on low, add 1 cup of sugar. Raise the speed to medium-high and beat until it is light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Add the vanilla and water and beat until incorporated. With the mixer off, scrape down the sides of the bowl.
Add all of the flour, then turn the mixer on low until the flour is just incorporated. Next, with the mixer off, add the pecans and turn the on low just until incorporated.
Using a small cookie scoop, scoop about one tablespoon of dough and roll with your hands to form smooth spheres.
Place cookies about one inch apart on a baking sheet. Bake cookies until golden brown on the bottom, about 40 minutes.
Roll the hot cookies in the ½ cup of sugar and let cool on a rack.
author: Megan Smith
